did.abstract: Collection consists of a letter from Greenwood, a Unionist, to John T. Cochran expressing concern over secession and the mortgage and insurance on property he owns in Washington, D.C. He asks Cochran to handle some matters related to the property and notes that he has advised the Indians on the border of Arkansas to remain neutral, at least for the present.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Alfred Burton Greenwood of Arkansas was a lawyer, congressman, and U.S. Commissioner of Indian Affairs.
